content: tsin bikéé knits *translation wooden shoe knits a design by tressa weidenaar trading post headband if you get the chance to venture into downtown gallup new mexico you will find many places where native american jewelry and art is traded and sold artisans bring their turquoise and stamped silver pieces into various trading posts to sell or pawn this headband is inspired by stamped jewelry with its repeating diamond design across the middle i like to think that i m wearing a bracelet around my ears to keep me warm on cool days needing to use up my spincycle and farmer s daughter fibers yarns this headband was the perfect way to use up those precious leftovers these soft warm yarns are comfortable to wear and are incredibly bright for this headband to display the colors © tressa weidenaar | for personal use only 1 difficulty level intermediate familiar with color-work charts able to knit in the round using two colors skills required cast on working in the round on circular needles working from charts stranded color-work bind off weaving floats size one size - adult medium finished measurements after blocking ​ circumference unstretched 19 ½ inches 50 cm height 4 ¾ inches 12 cm materials ➔ yarn ◆ mc spincycle yarns dream state 100% american wool 150 yards 1 skein ​ sample shown in color nostalgia or approximately 65 yds 59 m of dk / light worsted weight yarn ◆ cc the farmer s daughter fibers pishkun 100% mt and wy rambouillet 225 ​ yards/100 g 1 skein sample shown in color emil or approximately 50 yds 46 m of dk / light worsted weight yarn ➔ us size 3 3 25 mm and 4 3 50 mm 16 circular needles ➔ a beginning of the round stitch marker ➔ tapestry needle gauge ➔ 23 sts and 28 rnds = 4 inches 10 centimeters in charted pattern after blocking using larger needles abbreviations bor beginning of round p purl cc contrasting color round s round s k knit repeat repeat mc main color sts stitches © tressa weidenaar | for personal use only 2 directions with mc and smaller needles using the long tail cast on cast on 112 sts join for working in the round being careful not to twist sts and place bor marker begin bottom ribbing round 1 k1 p1 repeat around ​ repeat round 1 for three more rnds ​ ​ change to larger needles and knit one round begin colorwork chart join cc and work the 16 st repeat 7 times across work rnds 1-25 of colorwork chart one time break cc change to smaller needles begin top ribbing next round k1 p1 repeat around ​ repeat last round three more times ​ ​ bind off loosely in pattern weave in ends and wet block to finished measurements © tressa weidenaar | for personal use only 3 colorwork chart legend thank you for your interest in this pattern for questions contact me at tsinbikeeknits@gmail
